metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0066 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the netlink driver, there is a possible out of bounds write due to arace condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-65025077

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-19-generic - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-4.2.0-19-lowlatency - 4.2.0-19.23

linux-image-4.2.0-19-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-19.23
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-19-generic - 4.2.0-19.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-19.23').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1006.6').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
